      • clone

        public DecisionTreeBuilder.Configuration clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • getMinNodeSize

        public int getMinNodeSize()
        The minimum number of individuals in the training set that must be matched by a node. If a split would generate a node that would drop below this minimum size, the split will not be made.

        In effect, this ensures that DecisionTree.getPopulation() will return a dataset of at least minNodeSize rows for every node in a tree generated with this configuration.

        NOTE: minNodeSize should be less than getMinSplitSize().

      • withMinNodeSize

        public DecisionTreeBuilder.Configuration withMinNodeSize(int minNodeSize)
        See Also:
        getMinNodeSize()

      • getMinSplitSize

        public int getMinSplitSize()
        Get the minimum node size for which a split will be attempted. If the node matches less rows that this setting, it will not be split fruther. This differs from getMinNodeSize() in that it imposes a minimum node size before splitting, while the latter prevents a split if it results in nodes that are too small (after splitting).

        NOTE: getMinNodeSize() should be less than minSplitSize.

      • withMinSplitSize

        public DecisionTreeBuilder.Configuration withMinSplitSize(int minSplitSize)
        See Also:
        getMinSplitSize()

      • getHomogenityThreshold

        public int getHomogenityThreshold()
        The minimum percentage of rows required to be of the same value in the target column for a group to be considered homogeneous. A dataset that satisfies this homogenity threshold will not be split any further, even if it would satisfy getMinNodeSize().

        Valid range: [0, 100]

      • withHomogenityThreshold

        public DecisionTreeBuilder.Configuration withHomogenityThreshold(int homogenityThreshold)
        See Also:
        getHomogenityThreshold()

      • getMaxDepth

        public int getMaxDepth()
        Limits the maximum height of the generated tree. A maxDepth of 0 will generate a single terminal node containing all rows.

      • withMaxDepth

        public DecisionTreeBuilder.Configuration withMaxDepth(int maxDepth)
        See getMaxDepth().

      • getSplittingStrategy

        public SplittingStrategy getSplittingStrategy()
        Scoring function for deciding how to create split nodes when building the decision tree.

      • withSplittingStrategy

        public DecisionTreeBuilder.Configuration withSplittingStrategy(SplittingStrategy splittingStrategy)
        See Also:
        getSplittingStrategy()
